tit.cmt: 左記のみでよいと思いますので、英語表記のみに変更しました。

sen.j: 山科盆地（やましなぼんち）は、京都市山科区および伏見区醍醐地区を主範囲とする盆地。
sen.e: Yamashina Basin is the basin that covers the main region of Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City as well as Fushimi and Daigochi Wards.
Yamashina Basin is the basin that covers the main region of Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City as well as Fushimi and Daigochi Wards.
Yamashina Basin is the basin that covers the main region of Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City as well as Daigo area of Fushimi Ward.
sen.cmt: Daigo area of Fushimi Ward としました。

sen.j: 京都盆地をすぐ西に持ち、双子の盆地のような関係にある。
sen.e: It has Kyoto Bonchi (Kyoto Valley) just toward the west and had a relationship of a twin valley.
Kyoto Bonchi (Kyoto Valley) is located just west of the basin and was known as a twin valley.
Kyoto Basin is located just west of the basin and is known as a twin basin.

sen.j: 東は音羽山 (滋賀県・京都府)などに、北は比叡山に、西は京都東山 (京都府)に接し、南は山科川を軸にして宇治市六地蔵方面へ開けている。
sen.e: There was Otowa Mountain (Shiga and Kyoto Prefectures) in east, Mount Hiei toward north, Kyoto Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture) on west, and Yamashina River toward south as an axis, and opens toward the direction of Rokujizo, Uji City.

Otowa Mountain (Shiga and Kyoto Prefectures) to the east, Mount Hiei toward the north, Kyoto Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture) on the west, and Yamashina River toward the south, form an axis, which opens toward the direction of Rokujizo, Uji City.

Mt. Otowa (Shiga and Kyoto Prefectures) to the east, Mt. Hiei toward the north, Kyoto Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture) on the west, and the Yamashina-gawa River toward the south, form an axis, which opens toward the direction of Rokujizo, Uji City.
sen.cmt: Mt. Otowa, Yamashina-gawa River としました。"Yamashina-gawa River" -> "the Yamashina-gawa River" に変更しました。

sen.j: 近年は、各方面の山のふちにいたるまで住宅開発が進んだ。
sen.e: There is a housing development progressing to the foot of the mountains of all directions.
Housing development continues along the foot of the mountains of all directions.
Recent housing development has continued along the foot of the mountains of all directions.

sen.j: 東海道新幹線や名神高速道路はこの盆地を東西に貫通して走り、山科から南、醍醐、石田方面へは、京都市営地下鉄東西線と京都外環状線が軸として走っている。
sen.e: Tokaido Bullet Train and Meishin Highway Road run across the valley east to west, and Tozai Line of Kyoto City Subway and Kyoto Outer Loop Expressway run south from Yamashina toward Daigo and Ishida directions in the form of axis.

Tokaido Bullet Train and Meishin Highway Road run across the valley east to west, and Tozai Line of Kyoto City Subway and Kyoto Outer Loop Expressway run south from Yamashina toward Daigo and Ishida directions, forming an axis.

Tokaido Shinkansen (bullet train) and Meishin Expressway run across the basin east to west, and Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway and Kyoto Outer Loop Expressway run south from Yamashina toward Daigo and Ishida directions, forming an axis.
sen.cmt: Shinkansen, Meishin Expressway などと表現を修正しました。
